definition: Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out

sentences.english: Yan Fu was one of the representative figures of the reform idea.
sentences.chinese: 嚴復是維新思想的代表人物之一。

sentences.english: The word Liberty in Yan Fu's articles has different meanings.
sentences.chinese: 在嚴復的文章中，自由一詞有多層涵義，應區別對待。

sentences.english: The object of this thesis is to investigate the political philosophy of Yan Fu.
sentences.chinese: 本文考察的對象是嚴復的政治哲學思想。

sentences.english: My thesis will analyse the economic ideas of YanFu.
sentences.chinese: 本論文試對嚴復的經濟思想加以闡述與分析。

definition: Yang Wei (1979-), PRC badminton player, women's doubles specialist
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
Nü Shu writing, a phonetic syllabary for Yao ethnic group 瑶族 瑤族 dialect designed and used by women in Jiangyong county 江永縣|江永县 in southern Hunan
Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
